title: Valentine-themed “Will you be my valentine fizza?” website

requirements.text: Create a single-page Valentine-themed website that prominently displays the message “Will you be my valentine fizza?” and a short subtitle/instruction in English.

quotes: Create a will you be my valentine fizza website

acceptanceCriteria: On load, the page clearly shows the headline text “Will you be my valentine fizza?”
All user-facing text is in English
The page works on mobile and desktop and fits without horizontal scrolling

requirements.text: Add interactive “Yes” and “No” response buttons with playful behavior: clicking “Yes” shows a celebratory success state; clicking “No” shows a playful alternate reaction that encourages another choice without blocking navigation or breaking accessibility.

quotes: Create a will you be my valentine fizza website

acceptanceCriteria: There are clearly labeled “Yes” and “No” buttons
Clicking “Yes” transitions to a visible success/celebration state (e.g., message + animation)
Clicking “No” triggers a playful non-destructive reaction (e.g., message change and/or button movement)
Keyboard navigation works (Tab/Enter/Space) and buttons have visible focus states

requirements.text: Establish and apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme for the entire site (colors, typography, spacing, and components) with a Valentine + pizza (“fizza”) vibe; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette.

quotes: Create a will you be my valentine fizza website

acceptanceCriteria: A consistent design system is apparent across layout, buttons, and text
The palette is not predominantly blue/purple
Typography and spacing are consistent across screen sizes

requirements.text: Add the required generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the page (e.g., hero illustration and subtle background pattern).

quotes: Create a will you be my valentine fizza website

acceptanceCriteria: Images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames
The page visibly uses the hero illustration and background pattern
Images load correctly in production build (no backend routing for images)

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text
Frontend must be built with React + TypeScript, Tailwind, Shadcn UI composition, and React Query where needed
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT
Backend is single-actor Motoko; do not introduce additional backend services
nonGoals: Persisting responses on-chain or storing user data
Multi-page routing or a complex admin/editor interface

required: Cute heart-shaped pepperoni pizza illustration with Valentine motifs (fizza-hero.dim_1200x800.png)
Seamless repeating background pattern of tiny hearts and pizza doodles, light and subtle (fizza-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png)
